dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast view of the coastline in winter -- beaches, rivers sea marshes, inlets -- ebbing and flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For many, days and nights are spent fishing Pamlico Sound or crabbing the Neuse River. The CAMERA FINDS a small coastal town, edged by a harbor on which fishermen toil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA, MOVING inland, CROSSES OVER modest houses decked with plastic rooftop Santas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the ocean may be the focus of daily labor, churches have always tried to be the focus of life. And MOVES UPHILL TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where fake snow is sprayed on store windows. The CAMERA CONTINUES TO the far side of Main Street -- with its stately homes with big lawns, flower beds, and tasteful Christmas garlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I lived here, there were eighteen churches within town limits alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From each corner, four churches face each other. The Fellowship Hall Christian Church, the Church of the Forgiven People, the Church of Sunday Atonement, and All Saints Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sponsored pancake breakfasts, rummage sales, car washes, and softball games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA FINDS and FOLLOWS a newish sport utility vehicle with MD plates as it passes a rummage sale and a softball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think that all the people here were friendly, welcoming, open-hearted... Dr. LANDON CARTER, 33, drives the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon looks urban, prosperous, well-groomed -- but retains his boyish whimsy and sense of irony. A cell phone and overnight bag on the seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and that money or family background or education or luck didn't matter. Landon reaches out to adjust his side mirror, revealing a simple gold wedding band on his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's truck turns the corner and slows in front of the huge Southern Baptist church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they did matter. They mattered to everyone. Except Jamie Sullivan... Landon's truck turns into a driveway just past the church and heads for a cluster of buildings. Behind the buildings, a cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulls up in front of the old parsonage -- it's different color than he remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Astronomer. Actress. Believer in God... Landon hesitates a moment, then climbs out of his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon heads up the walk and onto the front porch. Presses the DOORBELL. It RINGS inside. Landon is edgy, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Believer in me. A nurse opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCK MUSIC drifts out open doors -- barely recognizable a "Born in the U.S.A." Students hang. Brains, preps, richies, heavy metals, jocks, punk rockers, goths, geeks. Mixing without mixing. Most are red-eyed, woozy, wasted. A couple of boys break dance to a BOOM BOX. Missing are the criminals... A shiny T-top CAMARO ROARS up. Stops, TIRES SQUEALING. VAN HALEN BLASTING. LANDON, 18, at the wheel. He is impulsive, sexy-troubled, with the nothing-to-lose courag to act on destructive whims. He is envied, copied, feared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMPTIES roll and CLINK on the floor. A tiny plastic skeleton dances as it hangs from the rearview mirror. Landon stamps a joint into the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient, edgy) Where is he? He's supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from back seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to whizz. ERIC's skinny, high-energy.          A leg always jigglin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric.    You're such a hummingbird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna dance. BELINDA is Landon's girlfriend. Richie princess, a bad- girl pretender. Big shoulder pads. Jellie bracelet. Swatch watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So go dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.    Don't.   Dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing, like Tattoo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dee plane. Dee plane. They laugh.       Clay's by the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAY, obese, wearing a too-small student monitor vest, is dumping garbage from a trash can. A loud HONK. Clay turns to see the Camaro, then turns back to the school, coast clear. He quickly heaves in the empty trash can as the Camaro pulls up. Eric pushes a door open.       Empties fall from the back Clay climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go go go go. PRINCIPAL ED KELLY, middle-aged, pockmarked skin, Casio calculator watch, exits the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's looking at Kelly in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly. He looks like his face caught fire and he tried to put it out with a fork. Landon inches the car forward, teasing Clay, teasing Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't find his own butt with both hands at high noon in a hall of mirrors. Sniggering laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Landon presses the gas.    The CAR ROARS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly's so old he --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done with that already, bonehead. Clay smiles, good-natured.    He often misses social cues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon drops Clay's student monitor vest out onto the road. Another car runs it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kelly walks over, picks up the vest. Shakes it. Frustrated. Eyes the empty beer bottles by the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camaro is parked on the dirt access road, headlights shining through the locked rear gate. JOHN COUGAR MELLENCAMP's "Small Town" playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, Clay, and Belinda sit drinking, smoking weed. Under the MUSIC, a CB RADIO scanner CHATS quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric finishes taking a leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling over, repeating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon. To save your life, you have to either go deaf or go numb in your dick and balls. Eric climbs back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, Belinda, Clay, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thinking. The doctor only gives you three seconds to decide --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I lose one ear and one nut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No questions, no negotiating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eric, annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you get these stupid questions -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypotheticals --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Belinda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just wondering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wonder. Landon's looking out at the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie Sullivan. Everyone looks up.     Derisive laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale, contemplative GIRL, 17, is jumping down off the gate, caught in the headlights. Wearing clothes she probably made herself; long hair hiding her face. She lives in her mind, not her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMIE (GIRL), hearing the laughter, gathers herself and approaches Landon's window, her SNEAKERS CRUNCHING in the GRAVEL. She crosses her pilly brown sweater across her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Landon, tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hi. Your lights. Any chance you could... turn them off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning over Landon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God give you this road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll be keeping the lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jamie, seeming nice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want the lights off, I'll turn them off. And he does.    Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.   Thank you so very much. She backs away from the car, grateful.        From the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see a friggin' thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon switches on the dome lights for Belinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Jamie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thank you. Thank you so very much.' But Landon's looking at Jamie.     Almost counting the seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie scaling the fence, practiced at it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon quickly flicks the high beams.     Belinda, Eric, Clay snicker and snort as they see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, startled, paused at the top. But instead of looking bullied, her face shows determination, humor even A moment later, she jumps down on the far side. Disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda, Eric, Clay are still laughing.       Landon's sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years. Where're you gonna be? (to Belinda, mocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypothetically?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.   With you. He clinks Eric's raised beer. More laughter. But Landon's face clouds slightly -- maybe this isn't where he'd really like to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Twilight Zone.' 'One Step Beyond.' 'Tales from the Dark Side.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Twilight Zone,' dipshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call him a dipshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't. (beat, re: Jamie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing I'd be doing. Laughter.    Landon kisses her.      With tongue. A blinding white light dances through the car and settles on Landon and Belinda's faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He scrambles out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon looks up at the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sitting atop, holding a large mirror, reflecting th headlights back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.   His annoyance turns to mild respect. The CB RADIO comes to life inside the car.     A GARBLED TRANSMISSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon leaps in.    Pops out the Van Halen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The address?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: York Ave. Landon pops in a WHAM! tape.     AMPS it UP.   "Freedom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What number? Nobody answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dildoes. Landon turns the car around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro fishtails away. TIRES CRUNCHING, red taillights bouncing on the rough road. The car turns left onto the paved road and speeds out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon drives recklessly.   Rushing.   He makes a SCREECH turn.

dialogues.speaker: STREET AHEAD
dialogues.text: Two fire trucks rumbling by houses, SIRENS WAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns right, following the fire trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon smiles at Belinda. She smiles back. Fun. Landon takes a slug of beer. Turns his eyes back to the road.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE TRUCKS
dialogues.text: make another turn. Then a flash of light, movement. figure on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old man walking his little dog.     Crossing the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turns the wheel hard.      Jams his foot on the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro swerves.     TIRES SQUEALING.   A LOUD, HEART- SEARING THUMP. The old man -- sideswiped, drops to the asphalt. The CAMARO SLAMS into a light pole.     CRUNCHING METAL. TINKLING GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.   Landon, Eric and Clay are banged up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Belinda's head leans on the dash. Her shoulders shake. Landon, bleeding on the forehead, reaches over. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She lifts her head.     Looks at him.   She's laughing. kicks his door out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro crumpled into the light pole. Headlights askew. Clay and Eric and Belinda getting out, dazed. Landon runs to the old man. Kneels. Shakes him.       No response. The man's TERRIER BARKS at Landon.

dialogues.speaker: LANDON'S FACE
dialogues.text: Frightened, anguished.     The real Landon showing for an instant. Police SIRENS WAIL in the b.g., growing LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered Chevette steers through a working-class neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's mother, CYNTHIA, 35, drives. She's weary with sun-worn skin, but still attractive. She wears a skimpy black-and-white cocktail waitress uniform under her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they expel you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz nothing happened at school. He smiles his biggest most reassuring smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't smile at me. It's not going to get you out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?   It always has before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By daylight, a modern brick and glass structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kelly gestures for Landon to sit.   Landon doesn't. His forehead still shows a bruise. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had hopes for you. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'd grow up to be president, another Reagan. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not laughing) Like you'd make it to June. Even cutting half your classes, you have a B- average.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.    You just act like one. On his desk, he places the empty bottles that rolled out of the Camaro. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those aren't mine. MR.KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came from your car. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't the one drinking. Kelly holds up the police test finding. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your blood alcohol level. Maybe you were legally in the clear, but I make the rules here. Landon scowls, knows he's defeated. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expelling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I can do what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is your oyster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon busts out, arms high, fists tight, like a righteou political prisoner. Freedom. He struts through the courtyard. Not a care in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon watches a tow truck lower the crumpled Camaro. A neighbor kid, JOSH, 12, watches from across the street, o his way to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon pokes and prods his car -- the engine, underneath, the body, the paint. A discouraging mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon knocks on Cynthia's bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.   I need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. She wears a black eye-shield.      Her waitress uni hangs over a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepy, annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting up to drive you somewhere. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon lifts the garage DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE GARAGE
dialogues.text: A murky place.   Filled with old tools and junk and a gri old bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon comes out the glass door, his arms loaded, sees hi bike. No way to carry. He looks around. The bus stop. A bus approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGING, RATCHETING, CLINKING. Landon's working hard. BOOM BOX playing SIMPLE MINDS' "Alive and Kicking."

dialogues.speaker: HIS MOTHER'S LEGS
dialogues.text: and worn terry slippers appear. CYNTHIA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you. He pauses, annoyed, then rolls himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mangled front bumper's on the ground. Cynthia stands there in her bathrobe. Upset. Landon's almost too much. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hanging round here all day. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hanging. I'm fixing my car -- CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a car you can't drive for a month. Go see Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a job. Landon ignores her.    Slides back under his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to try you as assistant manager. (beat) You could be manager someday. Landon can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon slides back out. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not working there. Cynthia sets her jaw.   He knows that look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon is sweating, scouring pots. A crooked cap on his head, an assistant manager name tag on his shirt. He's making some headway; only two more to wash. MARVIN, the owner, walks over. Beer belly, greasy hair. Dumps another pile of dirty pots and pans in Landon's sink. Landon glimpses his future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon paces, jumpy. Kelly's secretary, MISS TARBOX, quietly locks her purse in her bottom drawer. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he in with? MISS TARBOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be with you when he's available. The door to Kelly's office opens. Jamie Sullivan exits with her father, the tall stern REVEREND HEGBERT SULLIVAN Jamie eyes Landon as she passes by. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) You expelled, too? Nobody laughs or even smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kelly makes a note in Jamie's file. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding the real world to your liking, Mr. Carter? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up, surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back?   Were you ever really here? They both know Kelly has the upper hand.   Kelly leans ba in his chair, relishing it. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) I want to graduate. Kelly studies Landon, the boy who can't get out of his ow way. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking aloud) You could grace our hallowed halls again, if, while you're here, you make a sincere effort to be part of our little school community --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) I'd do that -- MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you do that, Mr. Carter? Landon shrugs, clueless. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Shall I give you a few ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, too)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides attending all your regular classes, I'd like you to help our janitorial staff after school --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the inner satisfaction it will bring. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday mornings, I'd like you to tutor disadvantaged students at our sister school --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm as underprivileged as they are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that you attend this school makes you privileged. His tone quiets Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, I'd like you to join the drama club. Rehearsals are Tuesday and Thursday evenings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd work backstage or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something. They're doing a play for the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I get time for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't.   That's the point. Landon's not happy, but he'll work with this.     As he h for the door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer, trying to reach him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, none of us faculty see you the way you see yourself. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us remember how your father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you remember more than I do.

dialogues.speaker: BROOM
dialogues.text: pushing gum wrappers under a radiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sweeps at the floor during the Star Club open house. A dozen nerds, including Jamie Sullivan (wearing her brown sweater), stand at astronomy exhibits. Students wander in, listen, look. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering question) -- Saturn's 15 degrees to the right of red Antares and much brighter. To her small audience, she holds up a contraption made from a wire coat hanger. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a very simple device made from a coat hanger, plastic wrap and typewriter correction fluid. Does anyone know what it is? No one does. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) A star frame. But Jamie hears.   She regards him a moment, then keeps going. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a star frame. Clay and Eric enter, checking on Landon, glancing at Jamie. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A star frame will help you locate stars and planets with your naked eye -- CLAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing, setting her up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Did God create the sun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking him seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, God created the universe and all its physical laws. Even Einstein said it's a miracle that our world is comprehensible --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If God can do all that, why can't he get you a new sweater? Landon laughs loudly.    Members of the club look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a joke. Laugh. Jamie smiles.    She can laugh at herself.     And she fi Landon funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon washes up while his mother sets the table.      Th MICROWAVE HUMS in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father dropped off an extra check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could help with a new car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I like the car I have. He picks up the envelope with wet hands. Without looking inside, rips it in half. Cynthia smiles, quietly happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enthusiastic preppies, richies, other do-gooders, singing "Karma Chameleon." Jamie sits in an aisle seat, reading, not singing. She turns around to look at Landon.    He rides in the back row, staring out the window, wearing a Sony Walkman, glum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Z.Z. TOP'S "Sleeping Bag." Out the window -- Jefferson High School coming into view. Bars on every window, chain-link fence around the parameter, no grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big room with tables and chairs but few books. Pairs of heads are bent over textbooks and notebooks. Landon sits with LUIS, a freshman boy of mixed ethnicity. A geometry text between them. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) -- 'So what is the measure of angle x if A and B are similar triangles?' Luis is lost, intimidated. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what 'similar' means? Luis shrugs. Luis looks down at the book as if for the answer, then at Landon, hopeless. He gets up and walks off. Landon looks up in disbelief and catches Jamie studying him. She's at a nearby table with her student, ISABEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR SWISHES SHUT behind Landon as he hops aboard. He's late and heads for the rear bench seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sitting there.   And no vacant seats save next to her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The bus begins to roll.   Landon lurches forward.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVELING
dialogues.text: The bus is moving through Beaufort. Landon sits next to Jamie. Putting a new tape into his Sony Walkman. His body turned away. She's reading her book. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to visit Harold? Landon scowls.   What-who is she talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let him out of the hospital yesterday. He's in a rest home on Oak Street. That old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to my father's church.   He could've died --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This your idea of small talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't make small talk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you not to give up. Sometimes you've got to back into the teaching from somewhere else. If he heard her, he makes no sign.     She goes back to h book. A long beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you volunteer? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know why I tutor reading? Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, growing up, books were my world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your book and your brown sweater and your hair. What's more to know -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I wear the sweater because I'm cold. I read because no one talks to me. My hair is my hair. What is it exactly that's bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care what people say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean care what you say? I'm worrying about other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?   The moons of Jupiter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you have a normal conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to have any conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, cuz talking to you is like trying to explain red to a blind person. She reads again. The bus pulls to a stop in front of Beaufort High. Belinda, wearing a neck brace, is waiting, leaning on her Cabriolet. Jamie watches Landon exit the bus.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Landon greeting Belinda, kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon opens a side door, peers in at the Drama Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big space with a stage. MS. GARBER stands before six geeky boys, and a dozen fat girls and Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon reacts -- this girl actually chooses to be in thes places? Ms. Garber looks up from her papers. MS. GARBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting, Mr. Carter. He slides in a row behind the others. Leans forward and pokes a boy, EDDIE JONES. Eddie's pimply and talks with his eyes squinched up. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the play? Eddie hands him a photocopied script, The Rainmaker. EDDIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The-the-there's this drought an' -- and a smooth t-t-alking guy comes and says he can m-make rain -- LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And the ugly farmer's daughter falls for him. I saw the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   It's really g-g-good --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It blows.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Jamie and Landon sit in folding chairs, reading from scripts. Landon's wooden, showing how lame this is. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck) 'I hope your dreams come true.' JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie, sad) 'They won't.' LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck) 'Believe in yourself and they will. Let me ask you, Lizzie. Look in the mirror? Are you pretty --?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Landon, are you trying to be bad at this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it just comes naturally. Jamie smiles.    Garber taps her script -- continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It's got to be inside you. Then one day the mirror will be the eyes of the man who loves you. You'll look in that mirror and you'll be more than pretty. You'll be beautiful.' Ms. Garber eyes Landon, motions for him to keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Look at me. Tell me what you see!' As Lizzie, Jamie looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Is it really me?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck, hamming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Yes. You're-you're b-b- beautiful.' Hoots and laughter.    Jamie looks away, humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! (announcing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon will play the role of Bill Starbuck. Groans among the boys.    Jamie is horrified.    So is La

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garber)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. No thanks. I can't do it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offstage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You can and you will, Mr. Carter. Kelly's been standing in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the sincerity and dignity you can muster. Everyone stares at Landon.     He's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. Landon exits behind all the others. Stands under an overhang, lights a cigarette, angry, waiting for a ride. Jamie approaches, something on her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like this fly, buzzing buzzing everywhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This play means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This play -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know you don't suck at acting. Landon laughs. Refusing to take her seriously. Behind him, the lights go out as the school closes for the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have to make it a big joke because only dorks and dweebies like doing theater --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What are you going on about? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can judge too.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He exhales, eyeing her, daring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care about classes or graduating. But you like school because you're popular and you know you'll never be on top again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's deep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Your act only works with an audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My act?! She walks off toward her father's old Pontiac.     The la car in the parking lot. Fire trucks rush by on the street below. Landon's ears twitch. He looks about. No one, no ride. He sees the Pontiac backing out of a parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon bangs on the side of her car as she drives past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ride?!   Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, wet, desperate, his eyes pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk about your helping me with my lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie's at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't want help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we both know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll point. You drive.    Faster. He points the way, to the taillights of the fire trucks. The wet road glistens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're following fire trucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (duh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's where the fire is? He fishes in his pocket for a tape. Pulls one out.      H searching the dash -- no cassette player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire is like a living thing. Wild. Unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Not like you. She jerks the car across the center lane. Driving on the wrong side of the road. He grips the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the -- ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you agree you need help?

dialogues.speaker: OUT WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Headlights looming, a car coming.      Closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! She swings the Pontiac back to the right lane. Smiling. A car zips by in the other direction, HORN BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Landon drops his attitude, his act.   He toys with the glove compartment knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kelly'll make me leave school if I screw up the play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 and 42. Pause.   He acts like he doesn't hear, but he's intereste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the friggin numbers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 is do something illegal.   42 is befriend an enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an enemy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda.    Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Jamie walk around the fire, watching the fire and the firemen. Landon is just tolerating her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I got the part... I'm a little like Lizzie. Except I don't worry about some man rescuing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing. If she's offended, she keeps it to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some kind of list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking to mock me or do you really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a little of both. They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a to-do list, but for my life. He smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't imagine the future, you won't have one. He lights a cigarette.       She reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a cigarette. 100. She grins and takes a drag.      They share the cigarette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what else is on this list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cajoling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to tell me... She eyes him, not certain she's willing to risk sharing her dreams with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guessing, rudely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get very wasted. Lose your virginity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spend a year in the Peace Corps. Make a medical discovery --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemptuous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being negative's a lot more work than being positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do know. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be two places at once... learn to hit a baseball or turn a cartwheel... eat breakfast with chopsticks... He likes the frivolity of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's... Number one? She looks away, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want help with your lines, I have two conditions. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to promise not to fall in love with me. He's certain she's joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have to meet my father. He looks at her like she's crazy to worry about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fathers love me.

dialogues.speaker: PARSONAGE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: swinging open. Reverend Sullivan looming tall.   Ichabod Crane in a collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon gives a cheery little wave. He's very sweaty.   Hi bike teeters on its kickstand in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   Landon Carter. Landon offers his hand. The Reverend shakes reluctantly, eyeing him closely: Landon's Army boots, torn jeans, dirty t-shirt, aloof manner. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You're in the play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lead man. Jamie slides out the door. She looks good in jeans and a white t-shirt. Almost normal. In the b.g., Landon's BIKE CRASHES over. He bounds down the porch steps. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining bike) They took my license for 30 days. But nobody's pressing charges. The Reverend looks at Jamie, concerned. Landon tries the kickstand, then leans the bike against a carefully trimme bush. Not the best place. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get something for us to drink --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother! But she's already gone.   The Reverend gestures toward th open front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and prim with stiff furniture left to fade. Landon pokes around, then stares at a photo of little girl Jamie with her parents. He looks up, aware that the Reverend is studying him closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know our planet would not suffer for one nanosecond if humans died off. But if ants disappeared, that would be catastrophic. The Reverend waits, letting Landon suffer the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidence flagging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apropos of nothing... so. So so so so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get something straight. You don't know me. I don't know you. But I know what you're about. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your distance from this house -- and from Jamie. His eyes lock with Landon's. His message clear. A NOISE and Jamie is there, carrying glasses of lemonade, all cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie washes the lemonade glasses, happy.      Her father comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carter boy. Tell me about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants help with his lines --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was driving the car that hit Harold Keene --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By accident --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, he's careless. Reckless. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really the best time to be making a new friend...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to always be alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to see him outside school activities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But I need to start deciding how to spend my time and my life. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry your mother isn't here to help you become a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I've become a woman without her. Just not a pretty one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie hops out of bed, pulls on jeans and a sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie peers into her father's room. He's sleeping.     Sh tiptoes to the staircase and down. Sneaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon is waiting when Jamie appears. He has scripts in his back pocket. They smile at each other, laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a softy. Got him wrapped around my finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know so.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She grins, skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie leads Landon toward the cemetery rear gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People think I'm strange, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I try to be nice to people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Maybe.    I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm strange? Pause.   Landon's caught off-guard by her frankness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   But that can be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie quickly scales the fence.       Landon's right afte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie drops down.     Takes a flashlight from her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz it's dark and quiet and you can see into another world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on top of gate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world of the dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being mysterious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be... He drops down, not sure what she means.      She's alread walking away. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's buried near here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's alive but it's like he's dead. She looks at Landon, feeling his sorrow, then unlocks a storage shed. Opens the door. Enters. Returns a moment later carrying several pieces of an odd-looking home-made cylindrical device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is my telescope.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The ten-inch Dobsonian telescope is pointed at the sky. The eye-piece is at the end of the long scope; the scope rests on a plywood base. Landon looks through the eye- piece.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON GOLDEN PLANET
dialogues.text: a beautiful view of a golden planet with a broad, flat ring system. WIDEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturn. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Voyager we expected maybe a dozen rings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there are thousands of them, made of floating ice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe debris from a moon that broke apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or building blocks for a world that never formed. She looks at him.    He smiles, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not smart.     Just a sponge. She smiles, disagreeing, then looks through the telescope and changes its view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I come here and just scan the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for intelligent life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for something -- someone. Pause.   He doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe you'll see your mother again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe she sees me now. Their eyes meet.     She looks away.    Changes the subje

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: telescope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm building a larger one to see the nucleus of Haley's Comet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirty snowball at its core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm probably not going to be around next time it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 76 years, me neither. She likes that he knows a little about astronomy. They each lean back on a tombstone and stare at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really into God, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ten words or less?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My relationship with God is my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you think about Him -- It -- Her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you do, how do you? Landon could joke or he could reveal something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in a church painting. I see this giant hovering over the ground. He's wearing a robe, and has long flowing hair, and he's pointing his finger at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever wonder why things happen the way they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there's a plan for everyone, but sometimes I don't understand what the message is -- or what the point is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no point. You live.     You die. The end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we're not supposed to understand, but we're supposed to have faith that someone else sees the big picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to believe to have faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bible. Why should I read a bunch of dumb stories about some ancient guy who supposedly worked miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interpreted by another guy like my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father doesn't like me. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I don't even trust me. He sits up and pulls Rainmaker scripts from his back pocket. He holds one out to her. A moment passes. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sneaks from the stairs to her room. Shuts the door. A light glows under the door, then goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his eyes, listens, then turns over and goes back to sleep. Not suspecting. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreary. Landon lies in bed, flipping the TV CHANNELS, past "Square Pegs," "Miami Vice," MTV, to a British natur documentary. After a moment, he searches for a pen and paper. Titles it "Life List." Pause. He doesn't know what to write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, Clay, Eric, Belinda. Eric's pickup is parked by Belinda's Cabriolet. RADIOS ON, BLASTING the same station, same song: JOHN FOGERTY's "Rock and Roll Girls."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women are definitely evolving into men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moustaches on some girls. Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Jamie Sullivan staring at us? They look.    Jamie's watching them.   They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to jump Landon's bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so pitiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deluded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart be still. They laugh more and she's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Landon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. He doesn't respond.      She shifts from foot to foot. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The play's going to be really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really glad you think so. His friends snicker and guffaw.      She looks at them, t back to Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you don't want to practice lines tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guessed right. She gives him a funny look and walks away.      A better person than he and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one girl who can't take a hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she doesn't know what a hint is. They laugh. Landon the loudest.      It feels good, but h also feels a little... bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaned up. Swept out. The Camaro is still a dented mess. But Landon drops its hood down, wipes his hands, and climbs behind the wheel. The ENGINE STARTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No posters of pop stars. Books by Houston Smith, Thomas Merton, Alan Watts, Carlos Castaneda. Jamie studies, listening to JONI MITCHELL's "I Wish I Had a River." The DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie opens the front door. Landon. A stern voice from the living room. Reverend Sullivan's. REV. SULLIVAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not be the Carter boy. Jamie shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon can't believe this.   He presses the BELL again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie? (beat) Open up. (beat) Open the door. Please. (long beat) Reverend Sullivan, I have to talk to your daught-- JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem? She's standing in the front yard. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not in a very good mood. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't miss a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps down off the porch. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The play's in a couple of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping we could run lines together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Just not at school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or anywhere where people might see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda's a very jealous person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be the reason. Pause.   He thinks she might be going for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's like you want to be secret friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! Exactly! You're reading my mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe you can read mine. She walks up the porch steps, goes in the front door, and opens it. Before she goes in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I saw something in you, something good. But I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie leans against the closed door, trembling, almost crying. In the living room, her father looks up from his reading, sees Jamie, then parts the curtains, looks out, glowers.

dialogues.speaker: OUT WINDOW
dialogues.text: Landon standing in the front yard, confused that Jamie would reject his generous offer of friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon walks to his car, then yells back at the parsonage LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to be so weird?! The front door opens, startling Landon. It's the Reverend. Red-faced with fury. Landon glares back, but then climbs in his car and drives off. Ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sits on the sofa.   Her father doesn't look up from his reading. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time I met him I knew. I'm proud of how you're handling yourself. Tears well and Jamie's face cracks with guilt and heartbreak. She leaves before her father can see her distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon lies in bed watching another British nature DOCUMENTARY, this one on astronomy. He reaches for his school yearbook. Flips the pages until he finds Jamie's photo.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE'S PHOTO
dialogues.text: She's smiling and looks almost cute. Listed under her photo are clubs: Red Cross, Stars and Planets, Drama. Ambition: To Witness a Miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Luis sit over the geometry text. Landon has just asked a question and Luis is shrugging sadly. Landon's eyes wander out the window.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Luis face each other across the half-court. Landon's got a ball and is further from the basket. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, me, and the basket. We're the three corners of a triangle. Take one step in. Landon and Luis both step forward. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I at the same angle to you and the basket as before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did we just make? LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A similar triangle? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else? What kind of triangle has three sides of different lengths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scalene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Make me an isosceles. Luis steps outward, directly opposite Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    Two sides the same. Landon tosses him the ball. They play. Jamie glances over from a picnic table where she works with her student Isabel. Landon looks at her, she looks away, he looks back. Thoughtful. Watching her. But not staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon studies the books in the spiritual/religion shelf.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks out a book, then sits in a corner. But before he opens the text, he looks around him, suddenly taking in all the books, all the learning, all the knowledge that could be his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the marquee: The Rainmaker. Under this, "All Invited." Under this, a full parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full house. Parents, teachers, students, churchgoers, booster club and rotary members.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: The set is a wealthy Midwestern ranch house of the 1950s. Eddie and two other BOYS play other characters. The play's underway...

dialogues.speaker: STAGE LEFT
dialogues.text: Landon watches, dressed as Bill Starbuck in a nicely fitted suit. Waiting for his entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as H.C., the father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Then why don't you talk to her?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Jim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Because if we do, she'll think we're trying to get rid of her.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as H.C., the father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'She'll sure think the same if I do it. You're her father and comes a time when a father's gotta mention.'

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: From stage right, Jamie makes her entrance as Lizzie.   A collective gasp from the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, wearing makeup, a dress that clings, her hair pulled back.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon can't take his eyes off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning, Pop. Boys. I dreamed we had a rain, rain coming down in sheets! Lightning flashed, thunder rolled up and down the canyon like a kid with a big drum!'

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan -- enraptured. Principal Kelly -- hopeful. Cynthia Carter -- uncertain. Clay, Eric, and Belinda -- rocking in their seats, snickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I know why you sent me to Sweetriver. Six boys in that family. The first three days, I stayed in my room.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Noah, the brother)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'What'd you do that for?'

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: A well-dressed man, DR. JONATHAN CARTER, Landon's father, slips in and takes a seat a couple of rows behind Cynthia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I knew what I was there for and they knew it, too!'

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Dr. Carter hangs on every word. Others sit on the edge of their seats. Even Clay, Eric, and Belinda. Belinda leans forward to take a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she ZOOMS -- Landon and Jamie on stage, growing larger

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Landon, Jamie, and the three boys.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: is Starbuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck, genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... You'll look in that mirror and you'll be more than pretty. You'll be beautiful. Look at me. Tell me what you see!' Jamie looks. She sees something in his eyes she hasn't seen in them before. Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Lizzie, choked up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Is it really me?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, her face lovely. Her eyes shining, radiating, looking directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon is dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Starbuck, heartfelt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Yes. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful.' Landon changes the line and nails it. Surprising himself. Surprising her. They both know it's sincere. A moment passes. Her stomach churns with anticipation. He leans in. She closes her eyes. They kiss. Gently, genuinely. When Jamie opens her eyes, they are filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The curtain crashes down.    End of act two. CLAPPING from the other side of the curtain. Landon tries to meet Jamie's gaze. But she's looking at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Principal Kelly, pleased. Cynthia Carter, proud. Clay and Eric, surprised. Reverend Sullivan, frowning, concerned. Belinda's face is cold, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon runs out, looking for his friends.      Mr. Kelly shakes his hand, then deals with parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda getting into her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda! Belinda stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! She waits.    Landon struggles with what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought! Landon watches her START her CAR, back from a parking space --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon. Landon turns.    His father is standing on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invited you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Kelly.    I thought we might get a bite --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hungry. Landon moves toward his Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon! Please. Don't walk away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you walked away from us? Landon opens his car door and gets in.         Not forgiv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon waits by Jamie's locker.       The BELL RINGS.   N Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon walks along the lunch line, looking.        No Jam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many many books. Landon cruises the stacks. No Jamie. Belinda, sitting at a table with a girlfriend, sees Lando and turns away. He doesn't pursue it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Clay watch Landon hammer out dents in the Camaro They're smoking, sharing some beers. Josh, the neighbor kid, stands across the street, wanting to be invited over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemptuous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's like some Puritan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not.    She's got her own ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutant ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe to you. Eric and Clay exchange a look -- is Landon defending her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda's telling everyone that kiss was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was. Eric and Clay smirk in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that you're scamming on Jamie Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not denying it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scamming's a strong word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's waiting when Jamie approaches her locker. Her hair pulled back. She looks good in a simple, fresh way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't in school yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to the doctor with my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healthy as can be. Pause. She doesn't help him.          She opens her locke what she needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.   So were you. Pause.   He tries to touch her hair.       She ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been nice to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hardly nice to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sits alone, reading, wearing her old brown sweater. Landon walks by Clay and Eric at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Puts his tray down on Jamie's table and sits.      Making public statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that would ruin your reputation how? She goes back to her book.    Ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? She doesn't look up.    Shows him the spine:     The Scar Letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reading all the novels on Mr. Rothberg's best American authors list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many books are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred. Then there's his classics list. And his European list. Landon realizes this is why she's always reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That on your 'Life List.'    To read all those books? She doesn't deny it.       He just dives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie. Maybe I want to try being positive. She looks up.    Examines his face for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I miss doing that dumb play with you. Students seated near them have overheard.      Whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you inspire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it. She picks up her books and tray.      Everyone is watchin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon follows Jamie out of the building.      Catches up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lack honor. You lack compassion. You lack honesty. You lack humanity. She heads to the old Pontiac.       Landon jogs after her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Maybe some of that is true --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the first thing about being someone's friend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be just your friend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't either. Take a look at yourself. Maybe you're scared that someone might actually like you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why would that scare me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because then you couldn't hide behind your books and your telescope and your sweater and your God. She gets into her car. Slams the door.        STARTS the ENGINE. She recognizes the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the real reason you're scared? You like me! She drives off. Clay and Eric, watching, guffaw at Landon's spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were really my friends, you'd be helping me, not running me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only one running you down is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sits alone. Legs dangling over. Lighting and dropping matches into the black beyond his feet. His body caught in the occasional sweep of car headlights. Nearby, an abandoned car.     A rusty old Yugo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon comes in from outside. Is surprised to find Cynthia sipping tea, wearing her uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out with Belinda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's over.   Way over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't know things if you don't tell me. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad came to the play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked. He wanted to get a bite -- after. I said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he moved out, I invited him to every practice, every game, every parent-teacher conference you ever had. He didn't show, not once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to show now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to let him? You going to reward him by being the son he was never man enough to be a father to? Landon doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is open to a lab where Jamie and the Star Club i meeting. Landon mops, working hard, while listening in. Inside, Jamie ignores him. Mr. Kelly watches from near the trophy case.      Almost approving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Carter. Don't wear a hole in that one spot there. Landon grins and moves on. Behind Landon's back, Mr. Kelly peeks into the science lab. Sees Jamie. Looks back at Landon. Wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon parks his Camaro.       It's shiny and buffed and perfect again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Christmas party for the tutors and tutored. A ROCK 'N' ROLL CHRISTMAS CD plays. A raffle ticket box by the door. A sign reads: "Win Movie Tickets." Landon enters, buys a ticket, then takes off his leather jacket. Underneath, a nice shirt and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room -- Jamie, looking pretty in a dress, laughing with her student, Isabel. Mr. Kelly talking with MR. REGINALD ADAMS, principal of Jefferson High. Luis runs over, diverts Landon's attention.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF ROOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Adams goes to a microphone.      Taps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone? Quiet please. As you all know, we're here to celebrate the holidays and to raise money to buy books for our library. The book drive is being led by Beaufort High's Jamie Sullivan. Applause. This is new. Landon looks at Jamie, who's smiling. She steps to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for buying tickets. We've raised two hundred and eighty-five dollars. More applause.    She steps down.

dialogues.speaker: LANDON AND LUIS
dialogues.text: Off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About enough to buy maybe five volumes in a set of encyclopedias. Luis smiles.    Jamie overhears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, with a finish in about a decade. She smiles.    He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I have something to say. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's number one on your list? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My number one would be getting out of Beaufort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting out won't be your problem. It'll be figuring out what you want when you get somewhere. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you can do anything. Landon smiles, not sure why she believes in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging on the front door:       a simple evergreen wreat a plaid bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark save for a gilded fake tree lit with tiny blinking lights and the glow of Cynthia's cigarette in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon! Come enjoy the tree! Landon?! Landon comes down the stairs. Sits on the sofa.       Wea another good shirt. She tries to reach out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look nice.     I should have dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fine like that, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's hot cider in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not moving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen Clay or Eric lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No great loss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go out. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I won't be long. He senses her hurt, but leaves anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Christmas tree with large colored lights stand in a corner. Jamie and her father playing cards. The DOORBELL RINGS. Then urgent BANGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon slides his backpack off his shoulder.      Pulls o shopping bag. Holds it out to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a present. Take it. She does. She opens the bag, pulls out a beautiful pink sweater. She's overwhelmed. Without a word, just a happy smile, Landon hops down the steps toward his car. Reverend Sullivan appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas! And to all a good night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie hums to herself as she brushes her hair. She's wearing the new sweater. Her father KNOCKS. Enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Landon Carter up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had rid ourselves of his disagreeable companionship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, why don't you get to the point where you get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he giving you a gift? Jamie doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give him a gift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the way he looked at you. The way he kissed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys like him have -- expectations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have expectations, too. Pause.   He's feeling her grow up, grow away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not changing the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't asked you to. They eye each other.    He's losing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nurse points Landon toward a patient room.     He carri battered liquor-store box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV flickers. Landon comes in. Opens the box.      Pulls out the evergreen wreath with the plaid bow. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me. Christmas is all about the smells. Landon leans the wreath in the window. HAROLD KEENE -- the old man from the accident, watches from his bed, baffled. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pine's my favorite. That and cider with cloves. Landon pulls a Thermos from his coat pocket.     Unscrews cap. Finds a drinking cup. Pours in cider.       Offers Harold the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon Carter.     I was driving the car that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
