dialogues.text: Me. Harold takes the cup, looks Landon over.    Landon appear genuinely contrite. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry -- HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a man are you, son? Pause. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honest) I don't know that I am -- a man. Yet. I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've worked on it my whole life. Harold reaches under his pillow.         Pulls out a smal of liquor. Tops off his cider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yourself a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thanks. Gotta keep my wits for the drive home. Harold nods, liking Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll sit a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon speeds, the windows open, WIND WHIPPING, DIRE STRAITS BLASTING. The Camaro turns and brakes and turns again, kicking up gravel, raising hell. The car slides to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon turns OFF the RADIO. Sits still. Wipes the rearview mirror clean, spotless. Unties the dangling plastic skeleton and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colorful banners and flags flap in the brisk WIND. talks with a used car SALESMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got a new V-6 and transmission. Alloy wheels. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New paint. Extra chrome.     Not a scratch anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reconditioned. Completely. Be a collector's someday. Twelve hundred. They look at the Camaro.    Shining in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't expect me to pay you for your -- attachment to that car. Landon gazes at another dealership across the street, the adopts the surly, vaguely-threatening attitude of old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. I expect you to pay me for yours. The Salesman looks from Landon to the car. He pulls a wad of cash from his pocket. Wearily counts out twelve bills. Landon takes the money, touches the Camaro's hood, then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marquee reads, "HAPPY HOLIDAYS!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One car. An old station wagon.        At the parking spac sign: "School Principal Only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly looks up from paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon? Landon drops a folded wad of hundreds on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Jefferson High. For books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine to give. I didn't steal it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say you did. But his tone implied it and Landon's already gone. Kelly is immediately sorry. He goes to his window and sees Landon pedal away on the old bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon watches a tow truck lower the abandoned Yugo. When the car is down, he sees Jamie standing on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon faces Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard what you did.   Thank you. He nods, but quickly changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the Yugo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She great or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing all this?   To impress me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But are you -- impressed? She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. She heads for her father's old Pontiac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Year's Eve. Would you go out with me?! She stops.    Turns around.    Surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    But not as a date date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to date. She smiles and gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon follows signs for the church office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon looks into the Reverend's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan is sitting behind his desk, examining legal-looking documents and records. He takes his glasses off, rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon knocks.       The Reverend looks up, furrows his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan. Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it have to do with Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The Reverend makes a small motion and Landon enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon doesn't sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to take Jamie to dinner on New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be possible. He looks back to his papers.    End of conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I haven't always treated Jamie the way -- I should have. She deserves better. Reverend Sullivan glances up.       As if surprised Lando still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see her hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever again. The Reverend looks out the window. A gray day, cold, bitter, stark. He considers his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have her home by one. And drive carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's under the Yugo's hood.     Josh, the kid from ne door, is in the driver's seat. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the engine. Josh turns the key. Nothing happens.     Under the hood, Landon changes something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. Josh tries the engine again.    Still no go.   Landon cha something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more time. Josh tries one more time. The ENGINE ROARS, then DIES, then amazingly STARTS again. It's running. Landon high- fives Josh, then sees an old station wagon turn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly hands a paper to Landon. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grades for fall semester. They're -- good. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You came here to give me my report card? MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen students with records like yours go to J.C. for a couple of years, then transfer to a good college. Landon understands what Kelly is implying. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd gladly write you a letter of recommendation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. MR. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, dressed with care, faces the mirror and wet combs his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seafood joint on the waterfront. Quaint, not fancy. Twinkle lights illuminate Jamie's face. Landon finds her lovely. Jamie picks. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you asked my father's permission. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted this to be a date. She watches Landon, happy, then perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon wolfing down his food.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a rush? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get you home by one. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only 7:30. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going somewhere. After. And no. I didn't ask your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon drives. The CARS' "Tonight She Comes" PLAYS.   He belches loudly, dramatically. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse you. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you want to. She grins.    And tries.   A small burp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the air all the way up from your stomach. He belches again.    Just as loud.   She tries again, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon steers the car into a parking lot for a miniature golf course with a castle-shaped video arcade and Little League diamond. A family entertainment center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sees where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing something -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we do this, I just want to say that a good life's gotta be about more than achieving stuff -- like on your list. She waits for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about working with what you already have -- right now -- at your fingertips -- you know, spontaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little bit of larceny in your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie's in the cage with a helmet on.    A machine tosses balls. Landon coaches from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing! Keep your bat parallel to the ground. Follow through. Follow through! Jamie is laughing too hard to hit anything. The balls keep coming. She ducks out of the way and grasps the fence and leans in. Landon leans in on his side. They'd be embracing if the fence weren't there. In the b.g., kids from their school.    Giggling, whispering. Landon looks over at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jamie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YUGO ROARS down the asphalt.    A sign for the approaching state line whips by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Landon.    With STEVIE NICKS' "Talk to Me" ON t RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cells in our bodies are always changing. In six or seven years all your cells have changed. You could be like a completely new person from the inside out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what's happening to you, only faster?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He grins.    Pulls the car over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.   Come on. He leaps out, leaving the headlights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon takes Jamie's hand and pulls her toward some invisible place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where -- what -- are we -- ? He keeps tugging her.     She follows him.   Laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? He leans down and lifts one of her feet a foot from the other. He notices a large bruise on her leg. She brushes her dress down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting like a crazy person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're straddling the state line. You're in two places at once. She's thrilled at his solution to her wish.       He walk the shoulder of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat after me. Huh?   He does a cartwheel.    She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A starry night with a bright moon. Glimmering silver water. Jamie and Landon walk onto a dock. DISTANT FIREWORKS BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's places like this that make me certain there's a God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sometimes not sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.    Pretty sure. They reach the end of the dock. She turns to face the WIND. It blows her hair. She turns his face the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the wind. I can't see it but I feel it. He closes his eyes.       Feeling the wind.   Opens them rejecting the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can measure wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncertainty makes you uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you actually know with religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder.     Beauty. Joy. (beat, quieter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love. She's embarrassed.       She tries to avoid implying anyt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother told me God is love, so when you're feeling love, you're feeling God. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think talking about these things -- threatens their very beauty and mystery. Her tone is matter-of-fact, but Landon's got a serious an tender look on his face. He touches her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're not supposed to. He moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might kiss you. She looks down.    Shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might do it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible. He touches her neck, her cheek, her mouth. Then leans in and kisses her. A tender, soft kiss. He pulls away. They look at each other a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jamie. There, he put it out there, risked looking and feeling foolish. Not the old Landon. Jamie looks away. Mixed emotions. Happy and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's when you say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't -- explain. She turns back to him, her eyes shining.     She touches face and they kiss again, deeply. But after a few moments, she drops her chin onto his shoulder. Smiling, glowing even, but slightly aloof, staring at the water. He pulls away slightly to study her face. He touches her cheek and brings her back from wherever she's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That.    And less strange. Tears run down her cheeks. Landon wipes them away with his thumbs, attributing them to happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon follows Jamie up the steps. The lights in the living room are on. THROUGH the windows, they can see her father taking down the Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be very quiet. He pulls her to him.      Kisses her.     The front door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Landon. Landon and Jamie separate, but Landon keeps an arm over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Reverend. Reverend Sullivan studies the two young people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Jamie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year. And he goes. Jamie walks by her father and into the house. Not saying anything. He watches her. What has he allowed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Jamie head into school.        Landon nods to Belinda, others. They glare back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Belinda and others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Jamie arrive at his locker.    It's been kicke in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assholes.     This happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice a year. Bang, bang, bang. Landon kicks in every locker in his row. A dozen in all. Jamie watches, a little frightened by his anger. But then he turns to her and grins. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they all match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon eats alone, ignored by Eric and Clay. Jamie approaches with her tray, red-faced, tearful. She hesitates about sitting -- feeling bad that Landon's being diminished, ostracized. She thinks he doesn't see her. But as she turns to leave, he pulls a chair out for her and smiles. She sits. Landon sees her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wr--? JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked up) The Challenger exploded. Principal Kelly's about to make an announcement. The PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM CRACKLES.    Landon takes Jamie hand as the room hushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon leads Jamie up, round and round, to the top of the tall steel tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the staircase to a small 360 degree overlook. Jamie's amazed at the view. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this place? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the divorce. My father used to take me here. Fire spotting was his summer job. They look off to the curve of the horizon, where sea meet sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here he proved to me the earth isn't flat. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On rainy days, we'd be above the clouds. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.   Talk.   Not talk. He pulls a deck of cards from his jacket pocket. They sit and he starts to shuffle. Not too well. Jamie takes the deck. Shuffles like a card shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie is already waiting when Landon's Yugo pulls up. gets out, walks to her, they kiss. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth.   I just left you out of it. She climbs up and over the wall.      He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie fits the pieces of her telescope together. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you build this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was twelve. Landon shakes his head, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that complicated. Landon doubts this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an alt-azimuth design with one parabolic mirror and one secondary flat one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the one you're building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my back yard. (pause, embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied before. It's hardly started. But when it's done, it will have twice the power of this one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, back up.     You lied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda.   Yeah. He grins, loving her even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars doesn't rise until 2:30

dialogues.speaker: A.M. --
dialogues.text: He opens his backpack.        Pulls out the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Thermos of hot coffee.       A blanket. Socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planned this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoped for it. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to seduce me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Why?   Are you seducible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm, but smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. He reaches back into his backpack.      Pulls out a secon blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ergo, a second blanket.   One for me, one for you. He hands her one.     She takes it, smiling, reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ergo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always home by midnight and he's always asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan sits up in bed.      His feet find slip on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan, wearing a robe, enters quietly. Checking on his daughter. Her bed is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Pontiac slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan looks down the access road to the rear cemetery gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo parked by the gate.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Reverend struggles with what to do. After a moment, he decides not to interfere; he'll pick his moment. He keeps driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Landon are looking at the heavens through the telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pluto? JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Virgo, but it's about 1000 times too faint to see. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the best thing I can see tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. He draws her close, they kiss. She shyly pulls away. Their hands still touching until she looks again into the telescope eyepiece. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second best thing is Jupiter. She swivels the telescope into position for Jupiter and steps aside so he can look. But he picks up the flashlight, pulls a diagram from his pocket. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you locate XXI5639I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She takes the diagram, studies it, and adjusts the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   Why am I looking at this star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I had it named for you.     I know it's not an official designation -- She couldn't be happier.     She reaches for his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful. I love you. It's the first time he's heard it. He pulls her into his arms. They kiss. Passionately. She starts to object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (respecting her boundaries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   I'm stopping. And he does.    They snuggle.   Silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's number one? Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In April when the dogwoods and wisteria are blooming... Get married. He doesn't make fun.     He strokes her hair.    Kisses h forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon enters from outside. Cynthia, still in her waitress uniform, is sitting at the table, drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late night or an early morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late night. (smart-aleck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleeping with her? Landon doesn't dignify this question with an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was cleaning yesterday.   I found this. She pulls Landon's Life List from her pocket.      Landon horrified. She reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scuba dive. Touch a moon rock. Learn to read Egyptian hieroglyphs. Go to college? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talking to you 'bout this stuff? Landon doesn't answer. She puts the list on the table. Smoothes it. Gently discouraging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, some of this is... farfetched. You take after me. People skills and common sense. Good dependable qualities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could take after Dad, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. You're handsome and charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant he's a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's eight years of school and training -- after college. And all that doesn't necessarily make you a better human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could do it if I tried.   Even Kelly thinks so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be something. She doesn't want to discourage him, but she wants him to be practical and realistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it doesn't happen, grab for something within reach. Life's tough enough without causing yourself disappointment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever my life is, I'm going to be friggin' sure I'm never disappointed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointment isn't something anyone plans for. (quieter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It catches you by surprise. Long pause.    They are both sorry to have raised their voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you how proud I am of you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, great. But what I want is for me to be proud of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon eats dinner with Jamie and Reverend Sullivan. Silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon.   You're not the quiet type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So talk to us about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You decide. Landon searches his mind for just the right subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Sure. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather. When he was seven, he shook the hand of an old guy, a war vet or something, who had once shaken President Lincoln's hand. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made a big impression on him. Reverend Sullivan looks at his daughter.       She's nodd interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin Mike. He's from a big family. He's the fifth kid. He heard that every fifth child in the world is Chinese. So he thought he was. Jamie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't tell him any different for years --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting to the point)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents are divorced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was five. My mom's a cocktail waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you -- the two of you -- get by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Materially or spiritually?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either. Both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We used to try to believe in each other. His eyes meet the Reverend's.      The Reverend's got to respect him some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan looks out the window into the back yard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie showing Landon the junk pile that will become her newer, larger telescope. They are laughing, jostling each other, comfortable, happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan and Jamie put the dishes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the Carter boy. Want to catch me up on recent developments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking if we're involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking how much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to tell him. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be the right thing. She turns to him, upset.    Her anger spilling out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But that's not the real reason. You think if I tell, he'll disappear and that's what you want! Me all to yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, stung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I want what's best for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This -- him -- Landon -- is what's best for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?    You're sure you can trust him? He's playing to her old insecurities.      She's not one hundred percent sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it better to know? Their eyes meet.     She knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Bueller's Day Off and Three Amigos! on the marquee Landon and Jamie exit as Belinda and a new boyfriend buy tickets. Clay and Eric and a crowd behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Belinda. She takes her boyfriend's arm, turns away, snubbing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, Eric. Eric says something inaudible and the whole crowd snigger and laughs. He's become Landon. Landon reddens, now realizing for certain that he's become a Jamie Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon and Jamie walk.       The theater in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his status)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From citizen high to citizen low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care, but just don't let it get to you. It gives them power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   I try to keep my power. He's impressed with how she manages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of your secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, one of many. He doesn't notice her tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITNEY HOUSTON's "How Will I Know?" ON the RADIO. Jamie flips the RADIO OFF. She's got something on her mind. Landon notices only that she seems a bit remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worried about your college applications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not applying to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you assumed. He looks at her, questioning.       She's looking out her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to take a year off? Join the Peace Corps -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over.   Now. Please. Tears are running down her face.        He pulls the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie gets out of the car.       Landon quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll take you home.      You'll feel better tomorrow. He tries to take her arm. She shakes off his hand, steps back. Wanting to be heard and understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon. I'm sick -- with leukemia. Landon tries to say something.         Nothing comes out. soul numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out last winter. I'm not responding to treatment anymore. His face crumples with pain and anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors said to do everything the same as long as possible. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want anyone being -- weird around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially you. (long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God gives me an illness, then you. A cruel joke. She gets in the car. Slams her door shut.       He stands there, not knowing what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon pulls up in front of Jamie's house.      A long qu ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting you die. Jamie just looks at him.    Feeling sorry for him -- what wants doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reverend and Landon drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her decision and she's decided not to tell people -- at least for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How -- how long does she have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, three months. Maybe less. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've given up. Reverend Sullivan hears the challenge in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her doctors have. Jamie and I. We're still praying for a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disdainful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon. We've lived with this for over a year now and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a God, how could he let this happen                        ! It's a long answer and by the time the Reverend opens his mouth to explain, Landon's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonless dark. Few cars. The YUGO RIPS down the road. Landon opens a map over the steering wheel. Turns on the dome light. Looks at the return address on an old letter. EXT. CITY STREETS (RALEIGH) - 3 A.M. Landon's Yugo winds through city streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mansions. Big lawns. The Yugo slows as Landon leans forward to read a street sign. His face is tear-streaked. He flicks his headlights to bright, then low again. The car turns left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large new colonial. Landon slams his car door and stands in the street. Staring at his father's house. He heads up a flagstone path for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon RINGS the resounding DING-DONG BELL, then bangs on the heavy wood door. Grief-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carter!... Carter!... Dad! Please!! I have to talk to you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elegant, thick carpets. Dr. Carter, putting on his robe, parts the silk drapes in the upstairs hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son standing on the front lawn.     Distraught, tearf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door!     Please!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon backs away from the house. Angrily kicks over a decorative planter. Is halfway to his car when Dr. Carter opens the door and comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon! Landon doesn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon!! Landon turns around. Sees his father. Breaks down, sobbing. His father goes to him. Hugs him, a big bear hug. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to save her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, who?   Is your mother all right? Lights pop upstairs. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jamie -- my girlfriend -- she has cancer -- you have to come look at her -- right now! DR. CARTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, trying to diffuse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the night -- LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit what time it is! Landon pulls away.   Angrier. DR. CARTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, I'm a cardiologist, not an oncologist --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a doctor, aren't you?!! He waves his father off, dismissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon!   I'll look into it!! But Landon hasn't heard. He's in his car. Dr. Carter watches his son's car move away, regretful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon quietly shuts the back door.        Exhausted.   S making coffee. Cynthia appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father called. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie's a patient at his hospital. He's having a colleague look at her chart this morning. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo parked in the driveway. The morning paper lying on the grass. Landon paces in front of the front porch. Incapable of ringing the bell, lacking the courage, lacking the right words. Upstairs, the curtains move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon pacing, talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She starts to raise the window, to say something, to help him, but then lets the curtain drop. She needs for him to decide, for him to be ready to face this with her. The sound of a CAR.   She looks out the window again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo driving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon lies on his bed in the dark. The PHONE RINGS. Landon stares at his extension. The RINGING STOPS. A voice from downstairs. CYNTHIA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your father. Landon picks up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Landon's room is ajar. Cynthia waits outside. Listening. Hearing nothing. She pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sitting on his bed.   Deflated. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cynthia is pained to see his suffering. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's incurable -- LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon -- LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Jamie) It was the only thing I've ever asked him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's still in bed. Facing the wall.     Cynthia KNOCK Enters with a plate of food. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought some dinner. No response.   She leaves the tray and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and her father eat dinner.   Jamie is red-eyed, heartbroken. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure at all) He'll call. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to think he'd changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he did change. Just not enough. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, you're not mad at me. You're mad at Landon -- JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) I am mad at you! And at Landon! And the universe! And God! (quieter) I don't even know where to put all my anger. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's normal. God accepts your anger. He won't punish you. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By making me ill, he is punishing me! (quieter) I just don't know what for. She flees the room.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS ACTION
dialogues.text: Goes up the stairs.    Keeps going.   Up another flight t the attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie opens a closet door. Pulls out a dress, a scarf, jewelry, a worn book -- her mother's belongings. She opens the book and starts to weep. Missing her mother.

dialogues.speaker: FOOT OF ATTIC STAIRS
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan stands, looking up at the attic stairs. Frustrated, angry, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon is still in bed. Cynthia enters.      Pulls back t curtains. Yanks up the shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you don't leave the house. But you have to get out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sits at the kitchen table.     Cynthia pours him a of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I may not be communicating very well right now. But let me be clear. Don't make this about you. It's about her. Pause.   Her words sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what to say. How to act. What if I do the wrong thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be yourself and I don't think there is a wrong thing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let Jamie take the lead. She'll let you know what she needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Landon can ring the bell, the front door opens. The Reverend. Landon runs past him into the house. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jamie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At school.    Where you should be. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted, classes are meeting. Landon runs, sliding to a stop at one classroom door. Looks in, keeps going, stops at another. Searching. This is JAMIE'S POV from the top of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: She stands, holding her books, watching him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: LANDON
dialogues.text: finally feels her gaze, turns to look.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: turns away, still angry and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: LANDON
dialogues.text: runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie! He catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE AND LANDON
dialogues.text: face each other.   Neither sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.    I'm a coward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have told you sooner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilt-ridden)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you do too many things, kept you up all night --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The drugs just stopped working. If anything, doing things I love kept me healthy longer. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you frightened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I have no one. She means not even God and he gets this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have me. He hugs her close, rocking her, comforting her and himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me live until I die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of students sit on stage reading from Our Town, rehearsing. Jamie and Landon sit together in the third row, holding hands. Landon glances at her, realizes she's asleep. Pulls her sweater over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sits with Luis; Jamie at the next table with Isabel. She looks pale. He catches her eye. They both smile, a little sadly, then turn back to their students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon drives them home from Jefferson High.      No musi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to build a tunnel under the English Channel. They're calling it The Chunnel. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He reaches into a cooler on the floor of the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim Jim? Apple? Yogurt?     You like yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to like yogurt. He places a red heart-shaped box in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very original. Happy Valentine's Day. He grins.   She looks crestfallen, feels terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even think about it. He takes a chocolate.     Pops it in his mouth.   Grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.   You gave me a chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Landon are looking at stars.      A long quiet moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I want you to take me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?    We just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to come here anymore. She begins taking the telescope apart.      Depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie looks at the high fence, weary, then reaches into a pocket for a key. Unlocks the gate. Swings the gate open. Landon's astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I've just never needed it. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you talk to my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've talked to your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I mean. Their eyes meet.     Her look is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan is up a ladder. Cleaning a gutter. Landon stands below, a few feet away, gathering his nerve He walks over.

dialogues.speaker: ON LADDER
dialogues.text: The Reverend is busy ignoring Landon standing below. long beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Being ignored is beginning to feel preferable to being noticed. The Reverend looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest. I don't know if I can pray, but I can do just about anything else. Neither Landon nor the Reverend see Jamie come out of the house and walk over.

dialogues.speaker: ON GROUND
dialogues.text: Landon shields his eyes with a hand to see the Reverend better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you need. Whatever Jamie needs. I'm here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could start by driving her to school --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back to school. Landon and her father both turn to her.      Pale, wane. understand what she is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell anyone you want.   I don't care. She goes into the house. Landon and Reverend Sullivan look at each other, then away, uncomfortable. That didn't sound like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, looking haggard, moves slowly as he cleans out Jamie's locker. Students stare as he carefully places her things, including the pink sweater, in a shopping bag. They part and hush as he passes by. News travels fast. Clay and Eric step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard 'bout Jamie Sullivan. She --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fierce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say nothing. Nothing 'bout her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misunderstood, genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Hey. We're sorry, man! Landon turns back. Surprised.        Inspects Belinda. Clay. Others. No one speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late and not enough. He pushes past Belinda's new boyfriend, heading for the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kelly and Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it means not graduating, but I need to be excused from all school acti--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're excused. Landon heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she? Landon can't answer.       Too emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will graduate. Landon looks up, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to tutor you myself. Landon nods, accepting, appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon puts away the contents of the shopping bag. Jamie's in bed, wearing the sweater. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday I felt sick, horrible. Today I feel like riding my bike. Or dancing. He turns on the CLOCK RADIO next to her bed. Finds a WALTZ. Offers his hand. Pulls her out of bed. She's in pajamas. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to waltz?? LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bashful) I was going to fake it. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always fake it. So they waltz, faking, stumbling and laughing, holding each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan hears the MUSIC and LAUGHTER.   He frowns, afraid for Jamie's health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie grips Landon's arms, seems to slip, suddenly too exhausted to carry her weight. Landon picks her up, gently carries her back to bed. Settles her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired. Landon sits on her bed. Strokes her hair. They look at each other. Landon reaches for her hand. When he looks at her face again, she's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon's sitting on his childhood tree swing, twisting side to side. Pensive. His mother comes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time seems to be slowing down and speeding up at the same time. She reaches to put a hand on his shoulder.       He lets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear gate is open. A caretaker waits while Landon carries pieces of the older telescope to his car. A tall pile of parts is already at his car. Eric and Clay drive up in Eric's pickup.    Gravel flying MUSIC BLASTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Clay spy Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon freezes, not sure what to expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck makes a circle around Landon, then stops. The MUSIC QUIETS. Eric and Clay jump down. A long tense moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Without a word, Clay walks to the Yugo, lifts the heavies telescope part, and carries it to the bed of the pickup. Eric follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon studies the pieces of the smaller telescope and ho they fit together. They are like a map for how to build the bigger one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon unloads an impossibly large round cardboard concrete form-tube from his car. Carries it around the house toward the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie wakes from a nap. She looks thinner, grayer. She hears HAMMERING. She hauls herself up and to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon working on the new telescope.    He looks up at he window. Sees her there. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan comes in to check on Jamie.    She's standing at the window. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that boy doing? She turns to look at him and collapses into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie lies in bed, eyes closed. Hooked to monitors, pumps, an IV drip. Landon holding her hand. Reverend Sullivan talks quietly with a doctor. Hearing bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is pink. A squirrel runs along a telephone wire. The Yugo is the only car in the visitor lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, in yesterday's clothes, dozes lightly. Jamie moves and he starts, fully awake. She opens her eyes. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She nods. Sleepy. Closes her eyes again. He rests his head on her shoulder and weeps. Her eyes open, then close again. There's nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan looks through the window in the door at the scene within. He hesitates, then pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon.   You go on home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not tired. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to be with her. There's only one chair.    Landon nods and goes. The Reverend sits, closes his eyes a moment.   When he opens them, she's looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. He kisses her forehead, then sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So serious. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie, God is not punishing you. No God I know wants anyone to be sick or feel pain or suffer. Pause. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Mom died you told me God wanted her more, loved her more -- REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong. Nobody could have wanted or loved your mother more than we did. Not even God. He lets this sink in. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God loaned you to me, entrusted you to my care. I'm failing you. She looks away, agreeing without saying so. REV. SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie. I make you the same promise that God does. (beat) I will always be with you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She sits up and embraces him. He wraps his arms around her. Tight. She closes her eyes, tears welling, never wanting to let him go. Her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the marquee on the front lawn: "WELCOME HALEY'S COMET." The Yugo parks in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon picks up a pile of books and assignments. Looks through them, then eyes Miss Tarbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jamie's book?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's everything Mr. Kelly gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next book on that list!   The Old Man and... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I need it today! Mr. Kelly steps out of his inner office.      Sees Landon anguished face, his exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive a copy over to her. Landon nods his appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie looks smaller. Her eyes have blue circles beneath. The Hemingway novel on the bedstand. Belinda pushes the door open. Peeks in. Not sure she is welcome. Landon is sitting in a chair.     He sees her, motions fo her to come in. Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her you were here. Pause.   Awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her this, okay? She hands Landon a small photo album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures from the play.   Jamie looks pretty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about how we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conciliatory)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    You're with who you should be.    It's like she chose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have no idea why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. She hugs him quickly, then leaves.       Landon goes to t window, looks out.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The sky is grayer, darker.      Landon is still at the wi Jamie wakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. He goes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something for you. She reaches under her pillow for the worn book from the attic. She offers it to Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's not a Bible. He takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother made it for me before I was born. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got quotes from famous people. Her favorite lines from books. Her thoughts. Landon looks at a page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.' Aristotle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower.   Same page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Find out who you are and do it on purpose.' Dolly Parton. A bookmark falls out.     He studies that page a moment.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGE
dialogues.text: from Corinthians.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Love is always patient and kind. It is never boastful or conceited -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was read at my parents' wedding. He takes her hand.     Holds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. I was really angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you have hope that you'll get better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pause, shrugging, accepting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I believe God has a bigger dream for me than I had for myself. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I believe the journey, the big adventure, never ends... He kneels on the floor.       Puts his head on her pillow to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I believe God sent you to me because I am ill. To help me through. He touches her face tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home. Pause.   He gets her meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to break)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It costs money to do this at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia pacing, talking on the phone, worried.   The fron door is wide open. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ... He doesn't talk to me, maybe not to anyone, except Jamie... She stands in the doorway and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon in his car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon just sits.    Exhausted, despondent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia pacing. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ... I've never asked you for extra. But we need it now... as soon as possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie's breathing is shallower. Landon's reading her The Sheltering Sky. He pauses, looks up. Isabel, Jamie's student, is standing in the doorway. Jamie sees her too. She smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Isabel comes in. Landon offers her the book. She takes it and keeps going from where Landon left off. Stumbling but reading. Jamie grins. JAMIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's been working with you? Isabel looks shyly at Landon. Jamie shakes her head, amazed. Landon nods to Isabel and she begins reading again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon quietly opens the back door to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sits at the table with Dr. Carter, his father. CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit with us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon enters, but doesn't sit. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his father) What are you doing here? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his mother) Now it's okay? CYNTHIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon. You have two parents. We're both here for you even --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- even if we're not here for each other anymore. Landon is listening. DR. CARTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do this. Please let me. He holds out a check.   For a lot of money.   Landon take it. Grateful. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to both parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smaller Jamie lies in a hospital bed, seemingly asleep. Hooked to an IV. Bottles of pills. Landon dozes in a comfortable chair. A nurse sits in a corner, reading.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eric and Clay stand in the doorway, not sure what to do. Jamie opens her eyes, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wake Landon. They tiptoe in.    Stand on either side of her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look scary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? A dumb question but she handles it well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things could be better. Awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought you'd be asleep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to help)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say either. Clay hands her an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? She pulls out a stack of worn bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the book drive.      Landon told us about it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told everyone at school. Jamie takes their hands, holds them. Thanking them silently. Her eyes shining with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon sits at his desk, sketching the larger telescope, making a few computations.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A library book on Haley's Comet is open.      A stack of similar books by his elbow. Cynthia enters wearing her waitressing outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do? He shrugs.    Tears fill his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's being done but it's not enough. I have to find something -- more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, honey. There's nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean about Jamie being sick. I mean about Jamie and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be with her when she wants.    Make sure she never feels alone. Landon thinks his mother is also talking about herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm not going anywhere.   Not yet anyway. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you are ready, I want you to feel free to go. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon opens Jamie's mother's book.     A photo of Jamie falls out -- one taken by Belinda.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Jamie, beautiful, smiling at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: LANDON
dialogues.text: considers the photo, finds a page to tuck it into.

dialogues.speaker: HANDWRITTEN JOTTING
dialogues.text: "For Landon" above some underlined text, a Psalm from the Bible. LANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) 'I cry to you my Lord, my rock! Do not be deaf to me, for if you are silent, I shall go down to the pit like the rest. Hear my voice raised in petition as I cry to you for help, as I raise my hands, my Lord, toward your holy of holies.' Landon knows Jamie underlined this for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon tears down the steps. Past his mother to the front door. He's out the door before she even turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan sits up in bed. His feet find slippers on the floor. He looks haggard, his hair thinner, his face defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reverend, wearing his robe, checks on his sleeping daughter. The night nurse nods as he tucks in blankets. A SOUND. Then another. Reverend Sullivan goes to the window. Parts the drapes. Looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen flashlights in a big circle. Landon in the middle, working feverishly on the new telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back porch light comes on. Reverend Sullivan steps out onto the back porch. Landon looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flushes, almost manic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to finish it tonight. Without a word, the Reverend turns around and goes back inside. Leaving the porch light on. Landon goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan comes out. Dressed. He carries two mugs of coffee and a brightly burning kerosene camp lantern. Peace offerings. He walks over, sets down the lantern, hands Landon a mug. Ready to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've almost finished the rocker. Did she order mirrors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there. As they walk to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have materials for the side bearings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm using an old phonographic turntable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the focuser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chrome-plated brass pipe from a drain line. The Reverend nods, impressed.    He yanks the garage door up. Goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I helped Jamie with the first one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she built it herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did. But hardly anyone does anything truly alone. The Reverend carries out a large cardboard postal package Landon takes it as the Reverend lowers the garage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to do this alone. Reverend Sullivan searches Landon's face for a long moment, understanding, then turns and heads for the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon stands in the doorway. The Reverend is wiping his glasses, his face, maybe of tears. He sees Landon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes ago. I have to ask you something. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was seventeen, I was sent up for a year for stealing a car. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I still feel that boy inside me and I don't like him. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like you. The Reverend stands, offers Landon his hand.     Landon t it. The two men shake. Allies now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie opens her eyes. But can barely keep them open. Groggy from pain medication. Landon's standing there. Showered, clean clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going out. He starts helping the nurse disconnect her IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I -- go out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be fine for a few minutes. Jamie looks at the nurse.    Uncertain.     The nurse nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon carries Jamie out a large attic window. The finished large telescope is set up. Pointing at the sky. She's in her nightgown, wrapped in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grateful, touching it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful... Thank you. But she looks at the lights of the house and streets around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what we'll be able to see... Help me stand. He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec. As she turns to him, questioning, the neighborhood suddenly darkens as the street lamps and lights in every nearby house are switched off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neighbors step outside.    Hold up binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members of the Star Club and other students look through traditional telescopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie hugs Landon in gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have five minutes. Jamie, tears streaming, braces herself against Landon and she peers into the telescope eyepiece. She pulls back, wipes her eyes, then looks again. She swings the telescope into the correct position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley's Comet, its icy nucleus issuing the jets and streamers of gas, dust, and debris that form the comet's hazy head and long tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comet of the century...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She steps back so he can see. He looks quickly, then moves aside so she can keep looking. She's completely engrossed. A long, quiet moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love me? She leans away from the eyepiece and looks at him -- yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do something for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon.    I can't even do for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you could, you would?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. His throat tightens with nervousness, with hope, fear, sadness, and love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: HER FACE
dialogues.text: Illness, happiness, disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of pink, purple, and white blossoms.    Dogwoods, wisteria, azaleas, and roses blooming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bursting with everyone who knows Jamie and Landon -- ever kid in their high school, including Eric, Clay, Belinda; teachers, including Ms. Garber; Mr. Kelly; Luis and Isabe and others from Jefferson High; her father's congregation Cynthia Carter; Dr. Carter's new wife and their two kids; neighbors; hospital staff and home nurses. Landon stands with his father by the altar. The "WEDDING MARCH" begins... The double doors at the back of the church open. Everyone turns to look at the bride. Gasps of joy and sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Flanked by a nurse and Reverend Sullivan. She's wearing her Lizzie dress from the play. It hangs loosely, but still becomes her. She's a beautiful bride.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Landon swells with pride. Jamie smiles. Then, leaning on her father, she slowly makes her way down the aisle. In the pews -- few dry eyes follow her. Jamie -- halfway -- stops to rest and catch her breath. moment later, she and her father continue. A long, difficult walk.    A walk to remember.

dialogues.speaker: AT ALTAR
dialogues.text: The nurse rolls a wheelchair up as Jamie and her father near. Applause breaks out as Jamie reaches Landon's side. Jamie sits.   Exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Landon kneels to be the same height as Jamie in her chair Pause.   Dr. Carter kneels.   Showing solidarity with his son. Reverend Sullivan, standing, leans down to kiss Jamie's cheek. Trying to keep his emotions in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan towering over them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Reverend Sullivan kneels, too. Jamie takes Landon's hand in her right hand, her father's hand in her left. Linking the three together. The congregation silences. Reverend Sullivan looks up from his Bible.     Struggling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a father, I'm supposed to give away my daughter. But I can no more give Jamie away than I can give away my heart. But I can let another share in the joy she has given me. May God's blessings be with you both. He reaches out, offering a hand to Landon.     Completing circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon, repeat after me. Do you take... As words are spoken and vows and rings exchanged, the CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the faces of those at the altar -- Jamie, Landon, Dr. Carter. TO the first row of the congregation -- Cynthia Carter, Josh, Eric, Clay. Then BACK row by row as the Reverend begins reading a passage from the book Jamie's mother made for her. His voice soft and melodious, like a poet reading his own work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Love is always patient and kind. It is never jealous. Love is never boastful or conceited. It is never rude or selfish. It does not take offense and is not resentful. Love takes no pleasure in other people's sins, but delights in the truth. It is always ready to excuse, to trust, to hope, and to endure whatever comes...' And the CAMERA MOVES OUT the double doors to find...

dialogues.speaker: PARSONAGE
dialogues.text: in a different season.      Winter. UP the front steps and INTO...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM, (PRESENT DAY)
dialogues.text: As it is now, in present day. The nurse disappears, leaving Landon Carter, 33, waiting. Looking at a framed photo of Jamie as Lizzie in The Rainmaker... The nurse returns, helping an old man as he shuffles in. Reverend Sullivan. He's stooped, thin, balding. His skin parchment thin. The two men embrace.       Stiff, uncomfortable, uncertai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting by. Pause.   Why is he here?     The Reverend waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- I'm returning something. He twists the ring on his finger.      Removes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This belongs to you. He gives his wedding ring to the Reverend.          Pause searches for something meaningful to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She taught me -- everything.     She saved my life. The Reverend turns away, overcome with sadness.         R now why Landon has come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're marrying again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie wanted that. She told me. Landon is grateful to know this.       He makes a move to Then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry she never got her miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did.    It was you. Landon, deeply touched, embraces the old man again. Warmly, fully. Two men still grieving, saying good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie once said when you're feeling love, you're also feeling God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landon walks alone.      His hair and clothing tousled by steady gentle wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made me a believer. In love. In life. In the journey that never ends... Landon stops.       Faces the wind.   Lets the air swirl him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And in the mystery of all things you can't see but feel everywhere around you... He closes his eyes.    She's there...
